00057 #ifndef _xmldoc_h
00058 #define _xmldoc_h
00059 namespace phys
00060 {
00061 
00062     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00063     /// @namespace phys::xml
00064     /// @brief This is where bulk of the XML subsystem is declare, there are numerous class that are all tighlty integrated so one file seemed appropriate.
00065     /// @details Our XML Parser IS a copy of PugiXML. It is simply the fastest,
00066     /// most stable, most reliable, feature rich, and robust XML parser we were
00067     /// aware of. We are using it with permission per it's included license. See the
00068     /// licenses folder, in either the docs folder, or the data/common folder. \n \n
00069     /// This XML parser uses an 'in place' design. It attmempts to load all of an XML document to one contiguous location in
00070     /// in memory, then create a tree of meta data that reference the already loaded document text. In testing this has been shown to be extremely fast.
00071     /// See pugixml.org for more details on the performace. \n \n
00072     /// The one drawback PugiXML had was that it has a completely different naming
00073     /// convention from our code. So we created a script ( docs/tools/PugiConversion)
00074     /// to covert version 1.1 and hopefully future versions to out naming convention.
00075     ///////////////////////////////////////
00076     namespace xml
00077     {
00078         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00079         /// @file xmldoc.h
00080         /// @brief The Doxygen documentation and minor tools to assist with the XML system
00081         /// @details The integration process for PugiXML requires that our changes all be stored in shell script.
00082         /// This is not condusive to good clean documentation  and is why the doxygen documention for the XML parser exist here
00083         /// instead of xml.h.
00084         ///////////////////////////////////////
00085 
00086         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00087         /// @file xml.h
00088         /// @brief This is where bulk of the XML subsystem is declare, there are numerous class that are all tighlty integrated so one file seemed appropriate.
00089         /// @details See xmldoc.h for additional details.
00090         ///////////////////////////////////////
00091 
00092         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00093         /// @enum ParseStatus
00094         /// @brief These statuses are used to help determine what issues, if any the parser had. the XML parser had.
00095 
00096         /// @var StatusOk
00097         /// @brief This is returned to indicated there where no issues parsing the XML document
00098 
00099         /// @var StatusFileNotFound
00100         /// @brief File was not found during a loading from filename attempt.
00101 
00102         /// @var StatusIOError
00103         /// @brief Error reading from file or stream.
00104 
00105         /// @var StatusOutOfMemory
00106         /// @brief Could not allocate memory.
00107 
00108         /// @var StatusInternalError
00109         /// @brief An unkown error, currently nothing should be able to return this status
00110 
00111         /// @var StatusUnrecognizedTag
00112         /// @brief The parser could not determine type of tag.
00113 
00114         /// @var StatusBadPi
00115         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing document declaration/processing instruction.
00116 
00117         /// @var StatusBadComment
00118         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing comment.
00119 
00120         /// @var StatusBadCdata
00121         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing CDATA section.
00122 
00123         /// @var StatusBadDoctype
00124         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing document type declaration.
00125 
00126         /// @var StatusBadPcdata
00127         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing PCDATA section.
00128 
00129         /// @var StatusBadStartElement
00130         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing start element tag .
00131 
00132         /// @var StatusBadAttribute
00133         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing element attribute.
00134 
00135         /// @var StatusBadEndElement
00136         /// @brief Parsing error occurred while parsing end element tag.
00137 
00138         /// @var StatusEndElementMismatch
00139         /// @brief There was a mismatch of start-end tags (closing tag had incorrect name, some tag was not closed or there was an excessive closing tag).
00140 
00141         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00142         /// @struct ParseResult
00143         /// @brief All the information needed to troubleshoot a Parsing error.
00144 
00145         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00146         /// @enum Encoding
00147         /// @brief These flags determine the encoding of input data for an XML document.
00148 
00149         /// @var EncodingAuto
00150         /// @brief Auto-detect input document encoding using Byte Order Mark (BOM) or < / <? detection; use UTF8 if BOM is not found .
00151 
00152         /// @var EncodingUTF8
00153         /// @brief UTF8 document encoding
00154 
00155         /// @var EncodingUTF16LE
00156         /// @brief Little-endian UTF16
00157 
00158         /// @var EncodingUTF16BE
00159         /// @brief Big-endian UTF16
00160 
00161         /// @var EncodingUTF16
00162         /// @brief UTF16 with native endianness
00163 
00164         /// @var EncodingUTF32LE
00165         /// @brief Little-endian UTF32
00166 
00167         /// @var EncodingUTF32BE
00168         /// @brief Big-endian UTF32
00169 
00170         /// @var EncodingUTF32
00171         /// @brief UTF32 with native endianness
00172 
00173         /// @var Encodingwchar_t
00174         /// @brief The same document encoding wchar_t has (usually either UTF16 or UTF32)
00175 
00176         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00177         /// @enum NodeType
00178         /// @brief The types of nodes.
00179 
00180         /// @var NodeNull
00181         /// @brief Empty (null) node handle.
00182 
00183         /// @var NodeDocument
00184         /// @brief A document tree's absolute root.
00185 
00186         /// @var NodeElement
00187         /// @brief Element tag, i.e. '<node/>'.
00188 
00189         /// @var NodePcdata
00190         /// @brief Plain character data, i.e. 'text'.
00191 
00192         /// @var NodeCdata
00193         /// @brief Character data, i.e. '<![CDATA[text]]>'.
00194 
00195         /// @var NodeComment
00196         /// @brief Comment tag, i.e. '<!-- text -->'.
00197 
00198         /// @var NodePi
00199         /// @brief Processing instructions to the XML parser, i.e. '<?name?>'.
00200 
00201         /// @var NodeDeclaration
00202         /// @brief Document declaration, i.e. '<?xml version="1.0"?>'.
00203 
00204         /// @var NodeDoctype
00205         /// @brief Document type declaration, i.e. '<!DOCTYPE doc>'.
00206 
00207         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00208         /// @var phys::xml::ParseMinimal
00209         /// @brief Minimal parsing mode (equivalent to turning all other flags off).
00210         /// @details Only elements and PCDATA sections are added to the DOM tree, no text conversions are performed.
00211 
00212         /// @var ParsePi
00213         /// @brief This flag determines if processing instructions (NodePi) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default.
00214 
00215         /// @var ParseComments
00216         /// @brief This flag determines if comments (NodeComment) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default.
00217 
00218         /// @var ParseCdata
00219         /// @brief This flag determines if CDATA sections (NodeCdata) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is on by default.
00220 
00221         /// @var ParseWsPcdata
00222         /// @brief This flag determines if plain character data (NodePcdata) that consist only of whitespace are added to the DOM tree.
00223         /// @details This flag is off by default; turning it on usually results in slower parsing and more memory consumption.
00224 
00225         /// @var ParseEscapes
00226         /// @brief This flag determines if character and entity references are expanded during parsing. This flag is on by default.
00227 
00228         /// @var ParseEol
00229         /// @brief This flag determines if EOL characters are normalized (converted to #xA) during parsing. This flag is on by default.
00230 
00231         /// @var ParseWconvAttribute
00232         /// @brief This flag determines if attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules during parsing. This flag is on by default.
00233 
00234         /// @var ParseWnormAttribute
00235         /// @brief This flag determines if attribute values are normalized using NMTOKENS normalization rules during parsing. This flag is off by default.
00236 
00237         /// @var ParseDeclaration
00238         /// @brief This flag determines if document declaration (NodeDeclaration) is added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default.
00239 
00240         /// @var ParseDoctype
00241         /// @brief This flag determines if document type declaration (NodeDoctype) is added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default.
00242 
00243         /// @var ParseDefault
00244         /// @brief The default parsing mode.
00245         /// @details Elements, PCDATA and CDATA sections are added to the DOM tree, character/reference entities are expanded,
00246         /// End-of-Line characters are normalized, attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules.
00247 
00248         /// @var ParseFull
00249         /// @brief The full parsing mode.
00250         /// @details Nodes of all types are added to the DOM tree, character/reference entities are expanded,
00251         /// End-of-Line characters are normalized, attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules.
00252 
00253         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00254         /// @typedef string_t
00255         /// @brief A string class used internally to store data in the XML parser.
00256 
00257         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00258         /// @var FormatIndent
00259         /// @brief Indent the nodes that are written to output stream with as many indentation strings as deep the node is in DOM tree. This flag is on by default.
00260 
00261         /// @var FormatWriteBom
00262         /// @brief Write encoding-specific Byte Order Mark (BOM) to the output stream. This flag is off by default.
00263 
00264         /// @var FormatRaw
00265         /// @brief Use raw output mode (no indentation and no line breaks are written). This flag is off by default.
00266 
00267         /// @var FormatNoDeclaration
00268         /// @brief Omit default XML declaration even if there is no declaration in the document. This flag is off by default.
00269 
00270         /// @var FormatDefault
00271         /// @brief The default set of formatting flags.
00272         /// @details Nodes are indented depending on their depth in DOM tree, a default declaration is output if document has none.
00273 
00274     }
00275 }
00276 #endif
